unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: One Proportion $z$-Interval: Finding the Minimum Sample Size
question_text:
You want to design a study for the proportion of adults who agree with this statement: "Do you think this coin will land on tails when I flip it?". You will use a $95\%$ confidence interval, and you want the margin of error to be $.05$ or less.
What is the minimum sample size that is required for those conditions?
solution:
The formula for a one-proportion $z$-interval is:

$$\hat { p } \pm z^*\sqrt { \dfrac { \hat { p } (1-\hat { p } ) }{ n } } $$

The margin of error in this content is after the $\pm $, meaning that it is:

$$z^*\sqrt { \dfrac { \hat { p } (1-\hat { p } ) }{ n } }$$

Our general set-up, then, looks like this:

$$z^*\sqrt { \dfrac { \hat { p } (1-\hat { p } ) }{ n } } \le M.E.$$

Let us start by substituting in the values we know. Since we are using a $95\%$ confidence interval, $z^*$ is $1.96$. Since we are not given $\widehat { p } $, we will make an educated guess as to what we expect it to be.

We will expect it to be $.5$, since the coin has a $50\%$ chance of landing on tails. By substituting the values in, our formula now looks like this:

$$1.96\sqrt { \dfrac { (0.5)(0.5) }{ n } } \le .05$$

Now we can solve for this.

1st step: Distribute the radical sign to both the numerator and denominator and simplify:

$$1.96\frac { \sqrt { (0.5)(0.5) } }{ \sqrt { n } } \le .05$$

$$1.96\frac { 0.5 }{ \sqrt { n } } \le .05$$

$$\frac { 0.98 }{ \sqrt { n } } \le .05$$

2nd step: We don't like working with fractions, so multiply both sides by $\sqrt { n } $:

$$0.98\le .05\sqrt { n } $$

3rd step: Divide both sides by $.05$ and simplify:

$$\frac { 0.98 }{ .05 } \le \frac { .05\sqrt { n } }{ .05 } $$

$$19.6\le \sqrt { n }$$

4th step: Square both sides and solve:

$$({ 19.6) }^{ 2 }\le ({ \sqrt { n } })^{ 2 }$$

$$384.16\le n$$

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect, as $19.6$ was square rooted instead of being squared.

Choice 'B' is incorrect, as $19.6$ was never squared.

Choice 'C' is incorrect, as $19.6$ was doubled and not squared.

Choice 'E' is incorrect, as $770$ is $385$ doubled.
